meanings.definition: To undergo a change or alteration in form or nature.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar will mutate into a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: Plants can mutate in response to different environmental conditions.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if my sandwich will mutate into a pizza if I leave it out too long.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas began to mutate, evolving into a groundbreaking theory.
meanings.sent5: The virus continued to mutate, becoming more resistant to treatment.

meanings.definition: To cause to undergo a change or alteration in form or nature.
meanings.sent1: The radiation can mutate the DNA of cells.
meanings.sent2: Excessive heat can mutate the structure of certain materials.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mutated my hair color when trying a new dye.
meanings.sent4: His words had the power to mutate her emotions in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The potion was rumored to mutate ordinary objects into magical ones.
